skill.name: browser-use
skill.description: Browser automation using Playwright MCP. Navigate websites, fill forms, click elements, take screenshots, and extract data. Use when tasks require web browsing, form submission, web scraping, UI testing, or any browser interaction.
skill.summary: Browser automation using Playwright MCP. Navigate websites, fill forms, click elements, take screens...
skill.author: 92Bilal26

security_audit.summary: Legitimate browser automation skill with transparent code. Static findings are false positives: JSON schema URLs with $ prefix were misidentified as shell backticks; subprocess usage is controlled (user-specified commands only); all network activity is limited to local MCP server on localhost:8808. No malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Browser automation requires repetitive manual interactions with web pages. This skill provides MCP-powered tools to navigate websites, fill forms, click elements, take screenshots, and extract data programmatically through Playwright MCP server.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to URLs and traverse browser history
Click, type, hover, and drag web page elements
Fill forms with multiple fields and handle dropdowns
Take screenshots of pages or specific elements
Extract page content via accessibility snapshots
Execute JavaScript for complex browser workflows
limitations: Requires running Playwright MCP server on port 8808
Cannot automate browser extensions or browser-specific features
Limited to single browser window per server instance

use_cases.title: Automate UI testing workflows
use_cases.description: Create end-to-end tests that navigate sites, fill forms, and verify page content programmatically.

use_cases.title: Extract data from web pages
use_cases.description: Navigate to pages, extract structured data from tables and lists, and save results.

use_cases.title: Automate form submissions
use_cases.description: Fill and submit web forms automatically without manual browser interaction.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate and explore
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants to browse a website
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the browser-use skill to navigate to {url}. Take a snapshot to see the page structure. Tell me what interactive elements are available.

prompt_templates.title: Fill a form
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs to complete a web form
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to {url}. Get a snapshot to find form fields. Fill the form with these values: {field-values}. Submit it.

prompt_templates.title: Extract data
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs data from a webpage
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to {url}. Get a snapshot or take a screenshot. Extract all {specific-data-type} from the page and format it as a list.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-step workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: When user has complex browser automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use browser_run_code to execute this Playwright workflow: {javascript-code}. Report the results.

output_examples.input: Navigate to example.com and extract all headings
Fill a contact form with test data
Take a screenshot of a specific element
output: Took screenshot of the product image element

best_practices: Start the Playwright MCP server before any browser task and stop it when complete
Always take a snapshot before clicking or typing to get current element references
Use browser_run_code for complex multi-step operations that should be atomic
anti_patterns: Do not navigate to untrusted websites that may execute malicious scripts
Do not submit sensitive credentials without verifying the target page
Do not leave the browser server running unattended for long periods

faq.question: What tools does browser-use provide?
faq.answer: 22 Playwright MCP tools for navigation, interaction, screenshots, JavaScript execution, and more.

faq.question: Does browser-use work offline?
faq.answer: The skill works offline but requires the Playwright MCP server to be running locally.

faq.question: Can browser-use handle CAPTCHAs?
faq.answer: No, browser-use cannot bypass CAPTCHAs or other anti-bot protections.

faq.question: Is my browsing data private?
faq.answer: All browser activity stays on your local machine through the local MCP server connection.

faq.question: Why do I need to start a server?
faq.answer: The Playwright MCP server provides persistent browser state across multiple automation calls.

faq.question: How is browser-use different from curl or wget?
faq.answer: Browser-use can interact with JavaScript-heavy sites and maintain session state like a real browser.
